task.title: Applying Profile Attributes
task.shortdesc: Learn how to apply profile attributes (conditional text) in Oxygen XML Author.

prereq.p: Ensure you have created profile attributes (conditional text) in your DITA document

step.cmd: Open the DITA document where you have defined profile attributes (conditional text) in Oxygen XML Author.
Select the content that you want to conditionally hide or show based on the profile attributes.
Right-click in the editor and select Edit profiling Attributes
On the Edit Profiling Attributes window, select the profile attribute(s) you want to apply from the list.
Select OK to apply the selected profile attribute to the content. The content will be conditionally displayed .
step.stepresult: By following these steps, you can effectively apply profile attributes (conditional text) to control the visibility of content in Oxygen XML Author. This allows you to tailor your documentation for different audiences or conditions defined by the profile attributes.

taskbody.postreq: After applying profile attributes, you can further customize and refine the conditional text behavior as needed in your DITA document.
